name: Finca Bellavista
title: (18200) Finca Bellavista
description:
Quiet and safe place, with 24-hour personalized attention, video surveillance cameras, closed area, with all services, showers, toilet, sink, washing machine, dryer, free Wi-Fi, rest area, large plots to put out awnings, chairs and tables.
Bus stop 200 meters away, tram stop 500 meters away (for 33 cents) directly to the center of Granada, taxi service, bakery service at 9 in the morning, supermarket 500 meters away, with bike path, with views of Sierra Nevada, near the A92 highway, entrance via GR30, exit 5.

title: (18220) Albolote - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area in the forest, near Granada. Flat terrain, perfect for one night. Many small trails in the forest. No services but many stone tables, barbecue / fire pit and garbage. Very quiet night (early April) but perhaps less in high season. The road continues by a track to a point of view with a tower. Practicable in van because we saw cars go down but we did not check.

name: Camping Granada
title: (18210) Camping Granada
description:
Small and family campsite. The plots are very good, both those without electricity (for people who do not need it) and those with electricity. The campsite people are very nice. The plots are large and sunny. Caravans cannot exceed 5.00 meters and motorhomes 7.00. It is located 11 km from Granada. Some plots have very good views of Sierra Nevada and Granada. Everything is very clean and the price is right. There is a lot of calm
Extra fee for electricity.

title: (18210) Peligros - 33 Calle Jacinto Guerrero
description: Street near the school, ideal for sleeping outside school hours.

It has washing facilities for mobile homes (up to 2.6m high, self-service, high-pressure cleaner), and water (the compressed air for the tires also has a tap with a hose for water, which is actually intended to refill the windshield wipers, but I have my tank with it also filled and it was no problem)

title: (18230) Atarfe -

swimming pool with bathrooms, showers, etc.

title: (18014) Granada - Avenida Federico García Lorca
description: This set of car parks along a low traffic lane is located in a new area of buildings under construction. Calm day and night, there are plenty of places nearby, allowing you to get to the city center of Granada by the nearby tram in about twenty minutes. The visit to the Alhambra took us 5 hours ( possibility to take the tickets on the spot without prior reservation in low season and early - an identity document is necessary for the entrance). We spent 2 nights there safely. Very good compromise to visit the city.

title: (18014) Granada - 371 Calle Periodista Luis Seco de Lucena

title: (18014) Granada - 103 Barrio PP-N3 Borde Norte
description: Ample and easy parking along the roads, near the motorway exit, with views of the Sierra Nevada, quiet area as it is new construction, next to a park with a water source. Tram 300 m away (JAEN stop) direction Armilla. To visit the Alhambra, get off at the "Recogidas" stop and from there walk about 2.2 km to the Alhambra, or take a taxi/Alhambra bus. It would certainly be possible to stay overnight as there were no prohibition signs, but it was certainly a bit noisy due to the cars driving past.

title: (18014) Granada - 116D Avenida de Maracena
description: 50m from the tram, ideal for visiting Granada . Quiet night. No service. Spacious seats for large motorhomes. What more.

title: (18014) Granada - 7 Calle la Calera
description: Parked on condition.. safe and quiet

title: (18014) Granada - 2 Calle Calicasas

Very close to the JAEN Metro stop that leaves you in the same Center. Nearby there is an Aldi and several restaurants. We slept 3 nights with no problem.

Bar with daily menu, cafeteria and car wash service. Bus stop 2 minutes away and taxi service.

ONLY FOR SHORT CAMPERS

description: Public parking in Alfacar. Well leveled, very central. Maybe it's a bit of a fuss because a lot of people are going, but for one night it's okay.

title: (18010) -

No convenience (no water point, no toilet, no shower) but in the middle of nature. No prohibition sign. A few minutes drive from the center of Granada.

description: A lovely place for a small camper. It is a dead end road, and is a lovely quite quiet spot for a small camper. We stayed one night. There is a lively restaurant nearby.

description: FREE parking - 15 min walk from city Centre - park only on white lines bays

A little low for the AC, because of the trees there are.
We arrived at night looking for a place to sleep and there were several free parking spaces, there are more parking spaces on the opposite side of the street. In the morning it gets a little more crowded because people come to the science park. Otherwise very quiet.

title: (18010) El Fargue -

some places for vans

description: Laundry in the main street of Churriana de la Vega. There is free public parking 30 meters away where you can park your vehicle while you do your laundry in Plaza Maestro Agustín. Very good tapas bars around the laundry room.

title: (18100) Armilla -
description: Open, lit parking area serving large retailers. Surprisingly tranquil overnight, almost no pedestrian traffic. 24hr McDonalds with toilets at hand, other cafés and restaurants nearby. Felt perfectly safe here both times I have stayed.

title: (18009) Granada - 3T Calle Perchel Alto
description: Free and sloping parking for a few places. Arrived at 07:15, several places available. Let's go visit the Alhambra Easier to access than the dead end next to the gemelos bar. No barrier at 2m on this small car park

title: (18006) Urbanización los Vergeles - Calle Baden Powell
title_short: (18006) Urbanización los Vergeles - Calle Baden Powell
description: Parking entry easy, very wide without interrupting traffic.

title: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 10 Calle Ricardo de la Cierva
title_short: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 10 Calle Ricardo de la Cierva
description: Parking attached to gas station galp with a bit of noise from the road but quiet.Carrefour to 100 m bus line to the center of Granada SN5 stop at the gas station of carrefour.

title: () Nívar - GR-3103
description: Night parking in the Sierra de Huetos

title: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 62 Carretera Granada
description: Parking at the edge of a fairly busy road. We slept a night without any problem. possibility to go see the historical places on foot. Carrefour supermarket next door.

title: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 4 Plaza Campus de la Salud
title_short: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 4 Plaza Campus de la Salud
description: It's a public parking lot, across from a home improvement store. On the one hand it is illuminated and on the other it is shaded. We were looking for a place to stay and it was perfect for us. It's quiet, you can hear the cicadas. It's on the edge of a residential area and you're in town with easy noise from the freeway. No bus, no noise from loading, (a few streets away). We feel comfortable here and have a good feeling.

title: () Alfacar - GR-3101
description: A quiet place about 8 km from Granada, near the natural park, very sloping.

title: (18008) Granada - 23 Avenida de Cervantes
description: Launderette 365 days a year from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m

title: (18009) Granada - 42 Calle Secanillo Alto
description: In January, only a few visitors, we found here in the dead end a free parking lot for 2 small campers. No turning possibility. Entrance to the Alhambra did not need to be pre-booked.

title: (18009) Granada - Calle Tramo de Unión
description: Expensive secure parking. Gravel underlayment bit steepish. Near Alhambra. Nice park to walk through. Price is high for the (lack of) facilities.

title: (18008) Granada - 26 Calle Primavera
description: I was quiet on the parking lot for 7 days. Can bike 2.1 km. quickly in the pedestrian zone. Alhamra is also 2 km away. No motorhome park. Free. Of course.

title: (18009) Granada - 50 Calle Perchel Alto
description: Space for a few vans at the side of the road. Very sloped so not ideal for overnight, but not prohibited. Great view of the city and possible to walk up the hill to La Alhambra.

title: (18008) Granada - 44 Camino Bajo de Huétor
description: Area where you can park for free along the road.  20 minutes walk from the center.

title: (18100) Armilla - 1 Calle Ernest Lluch
description: ASC station with cheap petrol, washing station and LPG.

title: (18009) Granada -
description: It is at the edge of a small road, just after the entrance to the cemetery on the right, there is a way to park by sticking the wall well. Only for small fitted out van otherwise risk of obstructing the passage for cars. Close his vehicle well and leave nothing of visible value, they tried to steal my bag in front of me while I changed behind, the guy stopped in a car at the height of my van and looked without seeing me, he opened the door and I caught him at that moment so careful, convenient place to visit the Alhambra (1.50km).

title: (18008) Granada - 5 Camino de los Abencerrajes
description: Very calm area. Quiet place to stay for the night. Walking distance to the city.

title: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 19 Avenida de la Investigación
title_short: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 19 Avenida de la Investigación
description: Urban parking, quiet area with a sense of security. I spent 5 days in January 2018 without problems. There are a lot of things within 5 minutes and a supermarket at 7. A bit of a walk from downtown. Without services.

title: (18100) Armilla - 74 Calle Alfonso Laveran
description: Quiet place to spend a night

title: (18100) Armilla - 25 Calle de Blas de Otero
title_short: (18100) Armilla - 25 Calle de Blas de Otero
description: Quiet parking. bus stop right next door. Take the SNE 5 to the Place des Américains (roundabout with a helicopter in the middle) then take the C3 for the Alhambra) or another for the cathedral.

title: (18008) Granada - 28B Calle Era
description: Close to the city, not far from Alhambra

title: (18007) Granada - Paseo del Emperador Carlos V
title_short: (18007) Granada - Paseo del Emperador Carlos V
description: Parking close to the city and for 6 euros by taxi to the city center

title: (18100) Armilla - 13 Calle León
description: Parking in the city center, bus that takes you to Granada. Attention Monday morning, parking prohibited, due to market.

title: (18008) Granada - 4 Avenida Salvador Allende
description: Public parking near the football stadium, quiet place to be parked, many nearby shops and metro in the city. The only thing that cannot be parked on the days that there are soccer games. Recommended place, very quiet and close to the highway.

title: (18100) Armilla - Av. de las Palmeras, 75
description: Customer parking lot from the shopping center "Nevada Shopping", perfect to park your motorhome during the day to take the tram to the city center. Duration of the trip by metro to the center about 15 - 20 minutes. The shopping center also has a large supermarket.

title: (18008) Granada - 16 Calle Cerro de los Machos
title_short: (18008) Granada - 16 Calle Cerro de los Machos
description: Roadside parking, relatively flat. A bit louder in the evening, but quiet at night.

title: (18110) Las Gabias - 1 Camino Río Dílar

title: (18007) Granada - Avda. Innovación - Parque Tecnológico
description: Very good starting point for sightseeing in Granada. Bus (green line 4) and tram right in front of the door, takes less than 20 minutes to get to the old town and doesn't cost much! The public parking lot costs just under 14 EUR a day. Parking in the center of Granada is hardly possible, at least on weekdays you look forever. So it's better that way and the camper is guarded. However, it is not really suitable for excess widths, at least there are no height restrictions.

title: (18100) Armilla - Av de las Palmeras
description: Noisy place, with a lot of traffic and people, music is heard.

description: Parking near the nevada

title: (18110) Las Gabias - 48 Calle Motril
description: Drinkable waterfountain - very accesible

title: (18179) Viznar - 40 GR-3101
description: Beautiful place in the countryside, there are several parking spaces for about 5 vans, mobile homes rather unsuitable. Please don't leave any rubbish. Hiking trail leads along. Free-roaming dogs. Abandoned, dilapidated sports field next to it.

title: (18100) Armilla - N-323
description: Llano suitable for overnight, we do not know how long this area lasts but for now without problems.

title: (18009) Granada - Unnamed Road
description: Place full nature with sight on Granada A little in slope but very calm and pleasant Respect the place please. Night prohibited.

title: (18008) Granada - 2 Calle Escritor Gabriel Ruiz

the second at 3.10 m dedicated to motorhomes and vans.
20 Euro /24H
Next to the football stadium, and the tram line, stop los carmenes

title: (18100) Armilla - 36 Calle Madrid
description: Lacolada chain laundrette, in the residential area of the Granada Armilla suburb, 5 minutes from the Nevada shopping center! Two machines 12 kg, one with 16 kg, two dryers on the street, few parking spaces, you may park at the entrance, but you can react if someone wants to get out!

title: (18008) Granada - 110 Calle Sala dos Hermanas
description: Single elevated lot a long walk from downtown. It is in a residential area, it is quite flat and you can enjoy wonderful silence. For the rest, it has no more interest because it is far from everything and there is no shop nearby (and also with quite a few slopes involved)

title: (18110) Las Gabias - 47 Calle Campo Santo
description: quiet parking

title: (18016) Granada - 6 Calle Avicena
description: It is roadside parking. Close to playground for children as well as for adults. In range of 600 m you will find good restaurants, laundry, lot of green for your pets. Parking is located close to Vircell so there is lot of cameras. The traffic is not large and completely unobtrusive.

title: (18100) Armilla - 38 Calle Acequia del Olivillo
description: It is a huge flat field where people walk their dogs or they come to “park”. The view of the city and the snowy Sierra Nevada is pretty. Quiet, you can barely hear the cars.  Lidl and Nevada Shopping Center few minutes away. Not clean though…

title: (18016) Granada - 6 Calle Avicena
description: Parking on the outskirts of Granada next to the hospital and faculties.

title: (18007) Granada - 72 Paseo del Emperador Carlos V
title_short: (18007) Granada - 72 Paseo del Emperador Carlos V
description: Repsol service station, LPG / Autogas filling point. You can fill refillable bottles here. (not for German bottles)

title: (18016) Granada - 33 Avenida del Conocimiento
description: Quiet place, we spent a night, the highway is heard. Next to a park with a fountain, in the morning it fills up with cars working nearby.

title: (18008) Granada - 11 Calle Plan Parcial 2
description: Good little parking lot (parking bay) to explore Granada. 100m to the next bus stop (line 33 goes to the center in 10 minutes). No service.

title: (18211) Cogollos de la Vega - 16 GR-3424
description: Parking next to the road behind an institute and away from the town, the area is very quiet, and there is practically no traffic because the road ends later, about 300 meters away there are garbage containers and a bar-restaurant called Catacena, highly recommended for eating, about 100 m from the bar, there is a spring water source, reached by a path that is attached to the fence of the institute, highly recommended to spend a quiet night.

title: (18110) Las Gabias - 2 Calle Rafael Alberti
description: Ground parking

description: Llano de la Perdiz. Very close to Granada with very nice views. Quiet place to spend as a family

title: (18179) Viznar - GR-3101
description: Not wanting to sleep in the natural park not being sure of the regulations we put the car on the low side in front of the park sign. Suitable only for a small vehicle or have holds. Certe roadside but if you do not want to risk a night in the park you can adopt this option.

title: (18179) Viznar - GR-3101
description: Free parking next to Amazonia Park (arborismo). Picnic and barbecue. Source but with poor access for motorhomes.

title: (18330) Chauchina - A-92
description: Stamped next to BP service station behind a busy restaurant. good place to park during the day, at night being next to the highway it is noisy, at night I moved further inside the polygon...interesting for a stop along the way.

title: (18009) Granada - Unnamed Road

For my Womo with 6.20 no problem, I would not recommend for bigger ones. Camping tents prohibited. Overnight in the motorhome was no problem. From 9 p.m. absolutely alone and quiet.

description: Drinking water tap. Of course it smells like chlorine but it's ok.
